title: 新约 - 罗马书(Romans) - 第 11 章
subTitle: 新约 -- 罗马书(Romans) -- 第 11 章 ( 本篇共有 16 章 )

lineList.en: I say then, Hath God cast away his people? God forbid. For I also am an Israelite, of the seed of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.
lineList.cn: 我且说，神弃绝了他的百姓吗。断乎没有。因为我也是以色列人，亚伯拉罕的后裔，属便雅悯支派的。

lineList.en: God hath not cast away his people which he foreknew. Wot ye not what the scripture saith of Elias? how he maketh intercession to God against Israel, saying,
lineList.cn: 神并每有弃绝他豫先所知道的百姓。你们岂不晓得经上论到以利亚是怎吗说的呢。他在神面前怎样控告以色列人，说，

lineList.en: Lord, they have killed thy prophets, and digged down thine altars; and I am left alone, and they seek my life.
lineList.cn: 主阿，他们杀了你的先知，拆了你的祭坛，只剩下我一个人，他们还要寻索我的命。

lineList.en: But what saith the answer of God unto him? I have reserved to myself seven thousand men, who have not bowed the knee to the image of Baal.
lineList.cn: 神的回话是怎吗说的呢。他说，我为自己留下七千人，是未曾向巴力屈膝的。

lineList.en: Even so then at this present time also there is a remnant according to the election of grace.
lineList.cn: 如今也是这样，照着拣选的恩典还有所留的馀数。

lineList.en: And if by grace, then is it no more of works: otherwise grace is no more grace. But if it be of works, then is it no more grace: otherwise work is no more work.
lineList.cn: 既是出于恩典，就不在乎行为。不然，恩典就不是恩典了。

lineList.en: What then? Israel hath not obtained that which he seeketh for; but the election hath obtained it, and the rest were blinded.
lineList.cn: 这是怎吗样呢。以色列人所求的，他们没有得着。惟有蒙拣选的人得着了，其馀的就成了顽梗不化的。

lineList.en: (According as it is written, God hath given them the spirit of slumber, eyes that they should not see, and ears that they should not hear;) unto this day.
lineList.cn: 如经上所记，神给他们昏迷的心，眼睛不能看见，耳朵不能听见，直到今日。

lineList.en: And David saith, Let their table be made a snare, and a trap, and a stumblingblock, and a recompence unto them:
lineList.cn: 大卫也说，愿他们的筵席变为网罗，变为机槛，变为绊脚石，作他们的报应。

lineList.en: Let their eyes be darkened, that they may not see, and bow down their back alway.
lineList.cn: 愿他们的眼睛昏蒙，不得看见。愿你时常弯下他们的腰。

lineList.en: I say then, Have they stumbled that they should fall? God forbid: but rather through their fall salvation is come unto the Gentiles, for to provoke them to jealousy.
lineList.cn: 我且说，他们失脚是要他们跌倒吗。断乎不是。反倒因他们的过失，救恩便临到外邦人，要激动他们发愤。

lineList.en: Now if the fall of them be the riches of the world, and the diminishing of them the riches of the Gentiles; how much more their fulness?
lineList.cn: 若他们的过失，为天下的富足，他们的缺乏，为外邦人的富足。何况他们的丰满呢。

lineList.en: For I speak to you Gentiles, inasmuch as I am the apostle of the Gentiles, I magnify mine office:
lineList.cn: 我对你们外邦人说这话。因我是外邦人的使徒，所以敬重我的职分。（敬重原文作荣耀）

lineList.en: If by any means I may provoke to emulation them which are my flesh, and might save some of them.
lineList.cn: 或者可已激动我骨肉之亲发愤，好救他们一些人。

lineList.en: For if the casting away of them be the reconciling of the world, what shall the receiving of them be, but life from the dead?
lineList.cn: 若他们被丢弃，天下就得与神和好，他们被收纳，岂不是死而复生吗。

lineList.en: For if the firstfruit be holy, the lump is also holy: and if the root be holy, so are the branches.
lineList.cn: 所献的新面，若是圣洁，全团也就圣洁了。树根若是圣洁，树枝也就圣洁了。

lineList.en: And if some of the branches be broken off, and thou, being a wild olive tree, wert graffed in among them, and with them partakest of the root and fatness of the olive tree;
lineList.cn: 若有几根枝子被折下来，你这野橄榄得接在其中，一同得着橄榄根的肥汁。

lineList.en: Boast not against the branches. But if thou boast, thou bearest not the root, but the root thee.
lineList.cn: 你就不可向旧枝子夸口，若是夸口，当知道不是你托着根，乃是根托着你。

lineList.en: Thou wilt say then, The branches were broken off, that I might be graffed in.
lineList.cn: 你若说，那枝子被折下来，是特为叫我接上。

lineList.en: Well; because of unbelief they were broken off, and thou standest by faith. Be not highminded, but fear:
lineList.cn: 不错。他们因为不信，所以被折下来。你因为信，所以立得住。你不可自高，反要惧怕。

lineList.en: For if God spared not the natural branches, take heed lest he also spare not thee.
lineList.cn: 神既不爱惜原来的枝子，也必不爱惜你。

lineList.en: Behold therefore the goodness and severity of God: on them which fell, severity; but toward thee, goodness, if thou continue in his goodness: otherwise thou also shalt be cut off.
lineList.cn: 可见神的恩慈，和严厉。向那跌倒的人，是严厉的。向你是有恩慈的，只要你长久在他的恩慈里。不然，你也要被砍下来。

lineList.en: And they also, if they abide not still in unbelief, shall be graffed in: for God is able to graff them in again.
lineList.cn: 而且他们若不是长久不信，仍要被接上。因为神能够把他们从新接上。

lineList.en: For if thou wert cut out of the olive tree which is wild by nature, and wert graffed contrary to nature into a good olive tree: how much more shall these, which be the natural branches, be graffed into their own olive tree?
lineList.cn: 你是从那天生的野橄榄上砍下来的，尚且逆着性得接在好橄榄上，何况这本树的枝子，要接在本树上呢。

lineList.en: For I would not, brethren, that ye should be ignorant of this mystery, lest ye should be wise in your own conceits; that blindness in part is happened to Israel, until the fulness of the Gentiles be come in.
lineList.cn: 弟兄们，我不愿意你们不知道这奥秘，（恐怕你们自以为聪明）就是以色列人有几分是硬心的，等到外邦人的数目添满了。

lineList.en: And so all Israel shall be saved: as it is written, There shall come out of Sion the Deliverer, and shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob:
lineList.cn: 于是以色列全家都要得救，如经上所记，必有一位救主，从锡安出来，要消除雅各家的一切罪恶。

lineList.en: For this is my covenant unto them, when I shall take away their sins.
lineList.cn: 又说，我除去他们罪的时候，这就是我与他们所立的约。

lineList.en: As concerning the gospel, they are enemies for your sakes: but as touching the election, they are beloved for the fathers' sakes.
lineList.cn: 就着福音说，他们为你们的缘故是仇敌。就着拣选说，他们为列祖的缘故是蒙爱的。

lineList.en: For the gifts and calling of God are without repentance.
lineList.cn: 因为神的恩赐和选召，是没有后悔的。

lineList.en: For as ye in times past have not believed God, yet have now obtained mercy through their unbelief:
lineList.cn: 你们从前不顺服神，如今因他们的不顺服，你们倒蒙了怜恤。

lineList.en: Even so have these also now not believed, that through your mercy they also may obtain mercy.
lineList.cn: 这样，他们也是不顺服，叫他们因着施给你们的怜恤，现在也就蒙怜恤。

lineList.en: For God hath concluded them all in unbelief, that he might have mercy upon all.
lineList.cn: 因为神将众人都圈在不顺服之中，特意要怜恤众人。

lineList.en: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! how unsearchable are his judgments, and his ways past finding out!
lineList.cn: 深哉，神丰富的智慧和知识。他的判断，何其难测，他的踪迹，何其难寻，

lineList.en: For who hath known the mind of the Lord? or who hath been his counsellor?
lineList.cn: 谁知道主的心，谁作过他的谋士呢，

lineList.en: Or who hath first given to him, and it shall be recompensed unto him again?
lineList.cn: 谁是先给了他，使他后来偿还呢。

lineList.en: For of him, and through him, and to him, are all things: to whom be glory for ever. Amen.
lineList.cn: 因为万有都是本于他，倚靠他，归于他。愿荣耀归给他，直到永远。阿们。
